greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows with zeros removed where T(n,k) is the number of integer partitions of n with k distinct multiplicities, n > 0.
comment: For example, the partition (32111) has multiplicities {1,1,3}, of which 2 are distinct, so is counted under T(8,2).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..200, flattened
example: Row n = 8 counts the following partitions:
xref: Row lengths are A056556. Row sums are A000041. Column k = 1 is A047966. Column k = 2 is A325243.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 15 2019
